comments.body: Is there a licence file associated with this?
There is, but it does not have an extension and it throws an exception with conda build.
That's odd, most licences I've had in recipes don't have extensions.

When I add the line 
```yaml
license_file: LICENSE
```
I get this after some

```bash
$ conda build flask_swagger_ui
```

The error is because the License was not packaged with the code on pypi (it doesn't exist in the tar.gz). Could you please open up an issue at the source code asking for the license to be included in the pypi package? Also can you please put a comment into this recipe with the issue URL?
Here it is: sveint/flask-swagger-ui#17. Do you want me to add it to the recipe file as well?
Yes but if wait until the osx build passes then add it and skip the CI. That way you don't need to wait for it it build again.
@CJ-Wright Added the comment to the recipe. Can you skip the CI? I don't think I have the permission.
The way you skip the CI is putting [ci skip] in the commit message.
I don't know if we have docs up for that yet (I'm checking now)
Sure, when the licence is released please create a PR against the feedstock to include it and bump the `build_number`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +35,39 @@  license: MIT
  summary: 'Swagger UI blueprint for Flask'
  license_family: MIT

extra:
